meanings.definition: Not consisting of or deriving from living matter.
meanings.sent1: The rock was inorganic and did not contain any living material.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the inorganic compounds in the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The inorganic soil refused to grow any plants, much to the gardener's frustration.
meanings.sent4: Her inorganic thoughts were like cold, lifeless stones in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The inorganic nature of the metal made it resistant to decay and rust.

meanings.definition: Not involving or relating to organic compounds.
meanings.sent1: The inorganic chemistry class focused on compounds without carbon.
meanings.sent2: The inorganic fertilizer helped the plants grow without using organic materials.
meanings.sent3: The inorganic ingredients in the recipe gave the dish a strange, artificial taste.
meanings.sent4: His inorganic approach to problem-solving was methodical and precise.
meanings.sent5: The inorganic nature of the plastic made it durable and long-lasting.
